summary: This is a transcript of a July 23, 2020 hearing before Judge Loretta A. Preska regarding the unsealing of documents in the civil case against Ghislaine Maxwell. The judge rules that the presumption of public access outweighs Maxwell's objections and orders numerous sealed discovery documents related to 'Does 1 and 2' to be unsealed, subject to redactions of personal identifying information and names of other nonparties. Maxwell's attorney requests a stay to appeal to the Second Circuit.

persons.name: Loretta A. Preska
persons.context: Presiding judge in the Southern District of New York hearing the motion to unseal documents in the civil case against Ghislaine Maxwell. She delivers the ruling ordering the unsealing of numerous documents.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the civil case. Her attorneys object to the unsealing of discovery materials, arguing they could prejudice her pending criminal trial. The judge notes Maxwell has since been indicted.

persons.name: Sigrid S. Mccawley
persons.context: Attorney representing the plaintiff (Virginia Giuffre) arguing for the unsealing of documents. She opposes Maxwell's request for a stay.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell. She argues against unsealing, citing Maxwell's recent indictment and potential prejudice to a fair trial, and requests a stay to appeal.

persons.name: Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney who submitted a declaration in opposition to a motion to compel. His name is mentioned in the list of documents to be unsealed.

persons.name: Schultz
persons.context: An attorney (likely for the plaintiff) who submitted declarations and correspondence mentioned in the list of documents to be unsealed.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of correspondence with Ghislaine Maxwell from January 2015, which is ordered to be unsealed.

persons.name: Joe Recarey
persons.context: Named as a Doe (Doe 84) in a notice of deposition and subpoena. The document containing his name is ordered unsealed in full.

persons.name: Michael Reiter
persons.context: Named alongside Joe Recarey as a Doe (Doe 84) in a notice of deposition and subpoena. The document is ordered unsealed in full.

persons.name: Stephen Olsen
persons.context: A doctor whose May 26, 2016 deposition excerpts are discussed. Portions relating to the plaintiff's medical issues are to remain sealed.

persons.name: Lightfoot
persons.context: A doctor (Dr. Lightfoot) whose June 27, 2016 correspondence is ordered to be unsealed.

persons.name: Will
persons.context: Judge Preska's law clerk, who is on the call to assist and correct any mistakes. He clarifies document content for the judge.

persons.name: Robert Sweet
persons.context: Previously presided over the case and decided the discovery motions that are the subject of the unsealing hearing.

connections.description: Menninger is Maxwell's defense attorney, representing her in the civil unsealing hearing and arguing against disclosure.
The document references correspondence between Maxwell and Epstein from January 2015, which is ordered unsealed.
They are opposing counsel in the hearing, with McCawley arguing for unsealing and Menninger arguing against it.
Will is Judge Preska's law clerk, assisting her during the hearing by clarifying document details.
Both are named together as 'Doe 84' in a notice of deposition and subpoena document that is ordered unsealed.

events.title: Hearing on Motion to Unseal Documents
events.description: Judge Loretta A. Preska holds a hearing via Zoom and rules that the presumption of public access outweighs Ghislaine Maxwell's objections, ordering numerous sealed discovery documents related to the civil case to be unsealed.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Deposition
events.description: Deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell taken on April 22, 2016. Multiple excerpts from this deposition are among the documents ordered to be unsealed.

events.title: Plaintiff Deposition
events.description: Deposition of the plaintiff (Virginia Giuffre) taken on May 3, 2016. Excerpts from this deposition are ordered to be unsealed.

events.title: Deposition in Dershowitz Matter
events.description: A deposition taken on January 16, 2016, in a matter related to Alan Dershowitz. Excerpts are ordered unsealed.

events.title: Scarola/Edwards Interview
events.description: A transcript of an interview conducted on April 7, 2011, with individuals named Scarola and Edwards. The document is noted as already public.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Indictment
events.description: Referenced by Maxwell's attorney, Laura Menninger, who states that since the briefing for the unsealing motion, Maxwell has been indicted and a criminal trial has been scheduled for July of the following year.

keyFacts: Judge Preska orders the unsealing of a vast array of discovery documents from the civil case against Ghislaine Maxwell, finding the public's right to access outweighs Maxwell's objections regarding embarrassment, untrustworthiness, and her pending criminal investigation.

Maxwell's attorney reveals that Maxwell has been indicted and a criminal trial is scheduled for July of the following year, arguing this new development heightens the risk of prejudice from public disclosure.
The documents to be unsealed include multiple depositions of Ghislaine Maxwell, the plaintiff, and various Does, as well as correspondence between Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein from January 2015.
Personal identifying information and the names of nonparties other than 'Does 1 and 2' are to be redacted from the unsealed materials, with further disclosure awaiting notice to those individuals.

Maxwell's attorney requests a two-week stay to seek an emergency appeal in the Second Circuit; Judge Preska grants one week to file the motion but instructs counsel to simultaneously prepare the documents for release.
